name: BOOKCHEETAH
tagline: JMU ISAT 2008 Senior Project and 2nd Place Winner of COB Venture Creation's 2008 Business Plan Competition. BOOKCHEETAH is a textbook trading app built with Facebook Platform, Amazon Web Services, PHP, and MySQL.
body:
### About the Project

BOOKCHEETAH is the brainchild of Lewis Muller. He and fellow James Madison University graduates Shea Munion, Matt Kattler, and Brian Armstrong wrote and submitted a business plan for the app in James Madison University’s Venture Creation Business Plan competition. Our business plan won second-place. (["Venture Creation Explores Viable Start-ups”](http://www.jmu.edu/cob/about/2008-news-archive.shtml)) The app itself won the Department of Integrated Science and Technology’s Community Impact Award. Shea Munion's Senior Honors Thesis is in print at the JMU library: [“Developing and integrating an online textbook trading application with Facebook platform, Amazon web services, PHP, and MySQL”](http://goo.gl/3eMeIB).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
